spec.name: Discord
spec.heading: Discord settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Discord

options.label: Title
options.description: Templated title of the message

options.label: Message Content
options.description: Mention a group using @ or a user using <@ID> when notifying in a channel

options.label: Use Discord's Webhook Username
options.description: Use the username configured in Discord's webhook settings. Otherwise, the username will be 'Grafana'

options.label: Message Content

spec.name: Email
spec.heading: Email settings
spec.description: Sends notifications using Grafana server configured SMTP settings

options.label: Single email
options.description: Send a single email to all recipients

options.label: Addresses
options.description: You can enter multiple email addresses using a ";", "\n" or  "," separator

options.label: Message
options.description: Optional message. You can use templates to customize this field. Using a custom message will replace the default message

options.label: Subject
options.description: Optional subject. You can use templates to customize this field

options.label: To
options.description: The email address to send notifications to. You can enter multiple addresses using a "," separator. You can use templates to customize this field.

options.label: From
options.description: The sender address.

options.label: SMTP host
options.description: The SMTP host and port through which emails are sent.

options.label: Hello
options.description: The hostname to identify to the SMTP server.

options.label: Username
options.description: SMTP authentication information

options.label: Password
options.description: SMTP authentication information

options.label: Secret
options.description: SMTP authentication information

options.label: Identity
options.description: SMTP authentication information

options.label: Require TLS
options.description: The SMTP TLS requirement

options.label: Email HTML body
options.description: The HTML body of the email notification.

options.label: Email text body
options.description: The text body of the email notification.

options.label: Headers
options.description: Further headers email header key/value pairs. Overrides any headers previously set by the notification implementation.

options.label: TLS config
options.description: Configures the TLS settings.

subformOptions.label: Server name
subformOptions.description: ServerName extension to indicate the name of the server.

subformOptions.label: Skip verify
subformOptions.description: Disable validation of the server certificate.

spec.name: Google Chat
spec.heading: Google Chat settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Google Chat via webhooks based on the official JSON message format

options.label: Title
options.description: Templated title of the message

options.label: HideOpenButton
options.description: Hide open URL button

options.label: HideVersionInfo
options.description: Hide version info

spec.name: Jira
spec.heading: Jira settings
spec.description: Creates Jira issues from alerts

options.label: API URL of Jira instance, including version of API
options.description: Supported v2 or v3 APIs

options.label: HTTP Basic Authentication - Username
options.description: Username to use for Jira authentication.

options.label: HTTP Basic Authentication - Password
options.description: Password to use for Jira authentication.

options.label: Authorization Header - Personal Access Token
options.description: Personal Access Token that is used as a bearer authorization header.

options.label: Project Key
options.description: The project key associated with the relevant Jira project

options.label: Issue Type
options.description: The type of the Jira issue (e.g., Bug, Task, Story). You can use templates to customize this field.

options.label: Summary
options.description: The summary of the Jira issue. You can use templates to customize this field. Maximum length is 255 characters.

options.label: Description
options.description: The description of the Jira issue. You can use templates to customize this field. Maximum length is 32767 characters.

options.label: Labels
options.description: Labels to assign to the Jira issue. You can use templates to customize this field.

options.label: Priority
options.description: The priority of the Jira issue (e.g., High, Medium, Low). You can use templates to customize this field.

options.label: Resolve Transition
options.description: Name of the workflow transition to resolve an issue. The target status must have the category "done". If not set, the issue will not be resolved.

options.label: Reopen Transition
options.description: Name of the workflow transition to resolve an issue. The target status must not have the category "done". If not set, the issue will not be reopened.

options.label: Reopen Duration
options.description: Reopen the issue when it is not older than this value in minutes. Otherwise, create a new issue.

options.label: "Won't fix" Transition
options.description: If reopen transition is defined, ignore issues with that resolution.

options.label: Custom field ID for deduplication
options.description: Id of the custom field where the deduplication key should be stored. Otherwise, it is added to labels in format 'ALERT($KEY).'

options.label: Custom Field Data
options.description: Custom field data to set on the Jira issue.

options.label: API URL
options.description: The host to send Jira API requests to

options.label: Project Key
options.description: The project key where issues are created

options.label: Issue Type
options.description: Type of the issue (e.g. Bug)

options.label: Summary
options.description: Issue summary template

options.label: Description
options.description: Issue description template

options.label: Labels
options.description: Labels to be added to the issue

options.label: Priority
options.description: Priority of the issue

options.label: Reopen transition
options.description: Name of the workflow transition to reopen an issue. The target status should not have the category "done"

options.label: Resolve transition
options.description: Name of the workflow transition to resolve an issue. The target status must have the category "done"

options.label: Won't fix resolution
options.description: If "Reopen transition" is defined, ignore issues with that resolution

options.label: Reopen duration
options.description: If "Reopen transition" is defined, reopen the issue when it is not older than this value (rounded down to the nearest minute)

options.label: Fields
options.description: Other issue and custom fields

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

subformOptions.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

subformOptions.description: Comma-separated list of domains for which the proxy should not be used.

subformOptions.label: Proxy Header Environment
subformOptions.description: Headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

subformOptions.description: ServerName extension to indicate the name of the server.

subformOptions.description: Disable validation of the server certificate.

spec.name: Kafka REST Proxy
spec.heading: Kafka settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Kafka Rest Proxy

options.label: Kafka REST Proxy
options.description: Hint: If you are directly using v3 APIs hosted on a Confluent Kafka Server, you must append /kafka to the URL here. Example: https://localhost:8082/kafka

options.label: Password
options.description: The password to use when making a call to the Kafka REST Proxy

options.label: API version
options.description: The API version to use when contacting the Kafka REST Server. By default v2 will be used.

options.label: Cluster ID
options.description: v3 APIs require a clusterID to be specified.

options.label: Description
options.description: Templated description of the Kafka message

options.label: Details
options.description: Custom details to include with the message. You can use template variables.

spec.name: MQTT
spec.heading: MQTT settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to an MQTT broker
spec.info: The MQTT notifier sends messages to an MQTT broker. The message is sent to the topic specified in the configuration.

options.label: Broker URL
options.description: The URL of the MQTT broker.

options.label: Topic
options.description: The topic to which the message will be sent.

options.label: Message format
options.description: If set to 'json', the notification message is the default JSON payload, and the Message field sets only the message field in the payload. If set to 'text', the Message field defines the entire payload. The default is 'json'.

options.label: Client ID
options.description: The client ID to use when connecting to the MQTT broker. If blank, a random client ID is used.

options.label: Message
options.description: In 'json' Message format, sets the message field of the default JSON payload. In 'text' Message format, defines the entire payload.

options.label: Username
options.description: The username to use when connecting to the MQTT broker.

options.label: Password
options.description: The password to use when connecting to the MQTT broker.

options.label: QoS
options.description: The quality of service to use when sending the message.

options.label: Retain
options.description: If set to true, the message will be retained by the broker.

options.label: TLS
options.description: TLS configuration options

subformOptions.label: Disable certificate verification
subformOptions.description: Do not verify the broker's certificate chain and host name.

subformOptions.label: CA Certificate
subformOptions.description: Certificate in PEM format to use when verifying the broker's certificate chain.

subformOptions.label: Client Certificate
subformOptions.description: Client certificate in PEM format to use when connecting to the broker.

subformOptions.label: Client Key
subformOptions.description: Client key in PEM format to use when connecting to the broker.

spec.name: Grafana IRM
spec.heading: Grafana IRM settings
spec.description: Sends alerts to Grafana IRM

options.label: Authorization Header - Scheme
options.description: Optionally provide a scheme for the Authorization Request Header. Default is Bearer.

options.label: Authorization Header - Credentials
options.description: Credentials for the Authorization Request header. Only one of HTTP Basic Authentication or Authorization Request Header can be set.

options.label: Max Alerts
options.description: Max alerts to include in a notification. Remaining alerts in the same batch will be ignored above this number. 0 means no limit.

options.label: Title
options.description: Templated title of the message.

options.label: Message
options.description: Custom message. You can use template variables.

spec.name: OpsGenie
spec.heading: OpsGenie settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to OpsGenie

options.label: Message
options.description: Alert text limited to 130 characters.

options.label: Description
options.description: A description of the incident.

options.label: Auto close incidents
options.description: Automatically close alerts in OpsGenie once the alert goes back to ok.

options.label: Override priority
options.description: Allow the alert priority to be set using the og_priority label.

options.label: Send notification tags as
options.description: Send the common annotations to Opsgenie as either Extra Properties, Tags or both

options.label: Responders
options.description: If the API key belongs to a team, this field is ignored.

subformOptions.label: Type
subformOptions.description: team, teams, user, escalation, schedule or a template

subformOptions.label: Name
subformOptions.description: Name of the responder. Must be specified if ID and Username are empty or if the type is 'teams'.

subformOptions.label: ID
subformOptions.description: ID of the responder. Must be specified if name and Username are empty.

subformOptions.label: Username
subformOptions.description: User name of the responder. Must be specified if ID and Name are empty.

options.label: API key
options.description: The API key to use when talking to the OpsGenie API.

options.label: API URL
options.description: The host to send OpsGenie API requests to.

options.label: Message
options.description: Alert text limited to 130 characters.

options.label: Description
options.description: A description of the incident.

options.label: Source
options.description: A backlink to the sender of the notification.

options.label: Details
options.description: A set of arbitrary key/value pairs that provide further detail about the incident.

options.label: Entity
options.description: Optional field that can be used to specify which domain alert is related to.

options.label: Actions
options.description: Comma separated list of actions that will be available for the alert.

options.label: Tags
options.description: Comma separated list of tags attached to the notifications.

options.label: Note
options.description: Additional alert note.

options.label: Priority
options.description: Priority level of alert. Possible values are P1, P2, P3, P4, and P5.

options.label: Update Alerts
options.description: Whether to update message and description of the alert in OpsGenie if it already exists. By default, the alert is never updated in OpsGenie, the new message only appears in activity log.

options.label: Responders
options.description: List of responders responsible for notifications.

subformOptions.label: Type
subformOptions.description: "team", "user", "escalation" or schedule".

subformOptions.label: ID
subformOptions.description: Exactly one of these fields should be defined.

subformOptions.label: Name
subformOptions.description: Exactly one of these fields should be defined.

subformOptions.label: Username
subformOptions.description: Exactly one of these fields should be defined.

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

subformOptions.label: Basic auth
subformOptions.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

subformOptions.label: Authorization
subformOptions.description: The HTTP authorization credentials for the targets.

subformOptions.label: Follow redirects
subformOptions.description: Whether the client should follow HTTP 3xx redirects.

subformOptions.label: Enable HTTP2
subformOptions.description: Whether the client should configure HTTP2.

subformOptions.label: HTTP Headers
subformOptions.description: Headers to inject in the requests.

subformOptions.label: Proxy URL
subformOptions.description: HTTP proxy server to use to connect to the targets.

subformOptions.label: No Proxy
subformOptions.description: Comma-separated list of domains for which the proxy should not be used.

subformOptions.label: Proxy From Environment
subformOptions.description: Makes use of net/http ProxyFromEnvironment function to determine proxies.

subformOptions.label: Proxy Header Environment
subformOptions.description: Headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

subformOptions.label: TLS config
subformOptions.description: Configures the TLS settings.

subformOptions.label: Server name
subformOptions.description: ServerName extension to indicate the name of the server.

subformOptions.label: Skip verify
subformOptions.description: Disable validation of the server certificate.

subformOptions.label: OAuth2
subformOptions.description: Configures the OAuth2 settings.

subformOptions.label: Client ID
subformOptions.description: The OAuth2 client ID

subformOptions.description: The OAuth2 client secret

subformOptions.description: The OAuth2 token exchange URL

spec.name: PagerDuty
spec.heading: PagerDuty settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to PagerDuty

options.label: Severity
options.description: Severity of the event. It must be critical, error, warning, info - otherwise, the default is set which is critical. You can use templates

options.label: Class
options.description: The class/type of the event, for example 'ping failure' or 'cpu load'

options.label: Component
options.description: Component of the source machine that is responsible for the event, for example mysql or eth0

options.label: Group
options.description: Logical grouping of components of a service, for example 'app-stack'

options.label: Summary
options.description: You can use templates for summary

options.label: Source
options.description: The unique location of the affected system, preferably a hostname or FQDN. You can use templates

options.label: Client
options.description: The name of the monitoring client that is triggering this event. You can use templates

options.label: Client URL
options.description: The URL of the monitoring client that is triggering this event. You can use templates

options.label: Details
options.description: A set of arbitrary key/value pairs that provide further detail about the incident.

options.label: URL
options.description: The URL to send API requests to

options.label: URL
options.description: The URL to send API requests to

options.label: Routing key
options.description: The PagerDuty integration key (when using PagerDuty integration type `Events API v2`)

options.label: Service key
options.description: The PagerDuty integration key (when using PagerDuty integration type `Prometheus`).

options.label: Client
options.description: The client identification of the Alertmanager.

options.label: Client URL
options.description: A backlink to the sender of the notification.

options.label: Description
options.description: A description of the incident.

options.label: Details
options.description: A set of arbitrary key/value pairs that provide further detail about the incident.

options.label: Images
options.description: Images to attach to the incident.

options.label: Links
options.description: Links to attach to the incident.

options.label: Source
options.description: Unique location of the affected system.

options.label: Severity
options.description: Severity of the incident.

options.label: Class
options.description: The class/type of the event.

options.label: Component
options.description: The part or component of the affected system that is broken.

options.label: Group
options.description: A cluster or grouping of sources.

options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

spec.name: Alertmanager
spec.heading: Alertmanager Settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Alertmanager

spec.name: Pushover
spec.heading: Pushover settings
spec.description: Sends HTTP POST request to the Pushover API

options.label: Device(s) (optional)
options.placeholder: comma-separated list; leave empty to send to all devices

options.label: Retry (Only used for Emergency Priority)
options.description: How often (in seconds) the Pushover servers will send the same alerting or OK notification to the user.

options.label: Expire (Only used for Emergency Priority)
options.description: How many seconds the alerting or OK notification will continue to be retried.

options.label: User key
options.description: The recipient users user key.

options.label: Token
options.description: Your registered applications API token, see https://pushover.net/app

options.label: Title
options.description: Notification title.

options.label: Message
options.description: Notification message.

options.label: URL
options.description: A supplementary URL shown alongside the message.

options.label: Device
options.description: Optional device to send notification to, see https://pushover.net/api#device

options.label: Sound
options.description: Optional sound to use for notification, see https://pushover.net/api#sound

options.label: Priority
options.description: Priority, see https://pushover.net/api#priority

options.label: Retry
options.description: How often the Pushover servers will send the same notification to the user. Must be at least 30 seconds.

options.label: Expire
options.description: How long your notification will continue to be retried for, unless the user acknowledges the notification.

options.label: TTL
options.description: The number of seconds before a message expires and is deleted automatically. Examples: 10s, 5m30s, 8h.

options.label: HTML
options.description: Enables HTML formatting of the message.

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

spec.name: Sensu Go
spec.heading: Sensu Go Settings
spec.description: Sends HTTP POST request to a Sensu Go API

options.label: API Key
options.description: API key to auth to Sensu Go backend

spec.name: Slack
spec.heading: Slack settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Slack

options.label: Recipient
options.description: Specify channel, private group, or IM channel (can be an encoded ID or a name) - required unless you provide a webhook

options.label: Token
options.description: Provide a Slack API token (starts with "xoxb") - required unless you provide a webhook

options.label: Username
options.description: Set the username for the bot's message

options.label: Icon emoji
options.description: Provide an emoji to use as the icon for the bot's message. Overrides the icon URL.

options.label: Icon URL
options.description: Provide a URL to an image to use as the icon for the bot's message

options.label: Mention Users
options.description: Mention one or more users (comma separated) when notifying in a channel, by ID (you can copy this from the user's Slack profile)

options.label: Mention Groups
options.description: Mention one or more groups (comma separated) when notifying in a channel (you can copy this from the group's Slack profile URL)

options.label: Mention Channel
options.description: Mention whole channel or just active members when notifying

options.label: Webhook URL
options.description: Optionally provide a Slack incoming webhook URL for sending messages, in this case the token isn't necessary

options.label: Endpoint URL
options.description: Optionally provide a custom Slack message API endpoint for non-webhook requests, default is https://slack.com/api/chat.postMessage

options.label: Color
options.description: Templated color of the slack message

options.label: Footer

options.label: Webhook URL
options.description: The Slack webhook URL.

options.label: Channel
options.description: The #channel or @user to send notifications to.

options.label: Markdown Fields
options.description: An array of field names that should be formatted by markdown syntax.

subformOptions.label: URL
subformOptions.description: Either url or name and value are mandatory.

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

subformOptions.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

subformOptions.description: Whether the client should follow HTTP 3xx redirects.

subformOptions.description: Headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

spec.name: AWS SNS
spec.heading: AWS SNS settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to AWS Simple Notification Service

options.label: SigV4 Authentication
options.description: Configures AWS's Signature Verification 4 signing process to sign requests

subformOptions.label: Region
subformOptions.description: The AWS region. If blank, the region from the default credentials chain is used.

subformOptions.label: Access Key
subformOptions.description: The AWS API access key.

subformOptions.label: Secret Key
subformOptions.description: The AWS API secret key.

subformOptions.label: Profile
subformOptions.description: Named AWS profile used to authenticate

subformOptions.label: Role ARN
subformOptions.description: AWS Role ARN, an alternative to using AWS API keys

options.label: SNS topic ARN
options.description: If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the phone_number or target_arn. If you are using a FIFO SNS topic you should set a message group interval longer than 5 minutes to prevent messages with the same group key being deduplicated by the SNS default deduplication window.

options.label: Phone number
options.description: Phone number if message is delivered via SMS in E.164 format. If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the topic_arn or target_arn

options.label: Target ARN
options.description: The mobile platform endpoint ARN if message is delivered via mobile notifications. If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the topic_arn or phone_number

options.label: Subject
options.description: Optional subject. By default, this field uses the default title template and can be customized with templates and custom messages. It cannot be an empty string

options.label: Message
options.description: Optional message. By default, this field uses the default message template and can be customized with templates and custom messages

options.label: Attributes
options.description: SNS message attributes

options.label: API URL
options.description: The Amazon SNS API URL

options.label: SigV4 authentication
options.description: Configures AWS's Signature Verification 4 signing process to sign requests

subformOptions.label: Region
subformOptions.description: The AWS region. If blank, the region from the default credentials chain is used

subformOptions.label: Access key
subformOptions.description: The AWS API access_key. If blank the environment variable "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" is used

subformOptions.label: Secret key
subformOptions.description: The AWS API secret_key. If blank the environment variable "AWS_ACCESS_SECRET_ID" is used

subformOptions.label: Profile
subformOptions.description: Named AWS profile used to authenticate

subformOptions.label: Role ARN
subformOptions.description: AWS Role ARN, an alternative to using AWS API keys

options.label: SNS topic ARN
options.description: If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the phone_number or target_arn. If you are using a FIFO SNS topic you should set a message group interval longer than 5 minutes to prevent messages with the same group key being deduplicated by the SNS default deduplication window

options.label: Phone number
options.description: Phone number if message is delivered via SMS in E.164 format. If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the topic_arn or target_arn

options.label: Target ARN
options.description: The mobile platform endpoint ARN if message is delivered via mobile notifications. If you don't specify this value, you must specify a value for the topic_arn or phone_number

options.label: Subject
options.description: Subject line when the message is delivered

options.label: Message
options.description: The message content of the SNS notification

options.label: Attributes
options.description: SNS message attributes

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

subformOptions.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

subformOptions.description: Comma-separated list of domains for which the proxy should not be used.

subformOptions.description: Makes use of net/http ProxyFromEnvironment function to determine proxies.

subformOptions.description: Headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

spec.name: Threema Gateway
spec.heading: Threema Gateway settings
spec.description: Sends notifications to Threema using Threema Gateway (Basic IDs)
spec.info: Notifications can be configured for any Threema Gateway ID of type "Basic". End-to-End IDs are not currently supported.The Threema Gateway ID can be set up at https://gateway.threema.ch/.

options.label: Gateway ID
options.description: Your 8 character Threema Gateway Basic ID (starting with a *).

options.label: Recipient ID
options.description: The 8 character Threema ID that should receive the alerts.

options.label: API Secret
options.description: Your Threema Gateway API secret.

options.label: Title
options.description: Templated title of the message.

options.label: Description
options.description: Templated description of the message.

options.label: Entity display name
options.description: Contains summary of the alerted problem.

options.label: State message
options.description: Contains long explanation of the alerted problem.

options.label: Monitoring tool
options.description: The monitoring tool the state message is from.

options.label: Custom Fields
options.description: A set of arbitrary key/value pairs that provide further detail about the alert.

spec.name: Webhook
spec.heading: Webhook settings
spec.description: Sends HTTP POST request to a URL

options.label: Authorization Header - Scheme
options.description: Optionally provide a scheme for the Authorization Request Header. Default is Bearer.

options.label: Authorization Header - Credentials
options.description: Credentials for the Authorization Request header. Only one of HTTP Basic Authentication or Authorization Request Header can be set.

options.label: Extra Headers
options.description: Optionally provide extra headers to be used in the request.

options.label: Max Alerts
options.description: Max alerts to include in a notification. Remaining alerts in the same batch will be ignored above this number. 0 means no limit.

options.label: Title
options.description: Templated title of the message.

options.label: Message
options.description: Templated message to be used in the payload's "message" field.

options.label: Custom Payload
options.description: Optionally provide a templated payload. Overrides 'Message' and 'Title' field.

subformOptions.label: Payload Template
subformOptions.description: Custom payload template.

subformOptions.label: Payload Variables
subformOptions.description: Optionally provide a variables to be used in the payload template. They will be available in the template as `.Vars.<variable_name>`.

options.label: TLS
options.description: TLS configuration options

subformOptions.label: Disable certificate verification
subformOptions.description: Do not verify the server's certificate chain and host name.

subformOptions.label: CA Certificate
subformOptions.description: Certificate in PEM format to use when verifying the server's certificate chain.

subformOptions.label: Client Certificate
subformOptions.description: Client certificate in PEM format to use when connecting to the server.

subformOptions.label: Client Key
subformOptions.description: Client key in PEM format to use when connecting to the server.

options.label: HMAC Signature
options.description: HMAC signature configuration options

subformOptions.label: Header
subformOptions.description: The header in which the HMAC signature will be included.

subformOptions.label: Timestamp header
subformOptions.description: If set, the timestamp will be included in the HMAC signature. The value should be the name of the header to use.

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Common HTTP client options.

subformOptions.label: OAuth2
subformOptions.description: OAuth2 configuration options

subformOptions.label: Token URL
subformOptions.description: URL for the access token endpoint.

subformOptions.label: Client ID
subformOptions.description: Client ID to use when authenticating.

subformOptions.label: Client Secret
subformOptions.description: Client secret to use when authenticating.

subformOptions.label: Scopes
subformOptions.description: Optional scopes to request when obtaining an access token.

subformOptions.label: Endpoint Parameters
subformOptions.description: Optional parameters to append to the access token request.

subformOptions.label: TLS
subformOptions.description: Optional TLS configuration options for OAuth2 requests.

subformOptions.label: Disable certificate verification
subformOptions.description: Do not verify the server's certificate chain and host name.

subformOptions.label: CA Certificate
subformOptions.description: Certificate in PEM format to use when verifying the server's certificate chain.

subformOptions.label: Client Certificate
subformOptions.description: Client certificate in PEM format to use when connecting to the server.

subformOptions.label: Client Key
subformOptions.description: Client key in PEM format to use when connecting to the server.

subformOptions.label: Proxy Config
subformOptions.description: Optional proxy configuration.

subformOptions.label: Proxy URL
subformOptions.description: HTTP proxy server to use to connect to the targets.

subformOptions.label: Proxy from environment
subformOptions.description: Use environment HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY and NO_PROXY to determine proxies.

subformOptions.label: No Proxy
subformOptions.description: Comma-separated list of addresses that should not use a proxy.

subformOptions.label: Proxy Connect Header
subformOptions.description: Optional headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

options.label: URL
options.description: The endpoint to send HTTP POST requests to.

options.label: Max alerts
options.description: The maximum number of alerts to include in a single webhook message. Alerts above this threshold are truncated. When leaving this at its default value of 0, all alerts are included.

options.label: Timeout
options.description: The maximum time to wait for a webhook request to complete, before failing the request and allowing it to be retried. The default value of 0s indicates that no timeout should be applied. NOTE: This will have no effect if set higher than the group_interval.

options.label: HTTP Config
options.description: Note that `basic_auth` and `bearer_token` options are mutually exclusive.

subformOptions.label: Basic auth
subformOptions.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

subformOptions.label: Authorization
subformOptions.description: The HTTP authorization credentials for the targets.

subformOptions.label: Follow redirects
subformOptions.description: Whether the client should follow HTTP 3xx redirects.

subformOptions.label: Enable HTTP2
subformOptions.description: Whether the client should configure HTTP2.

subformOptions.label: HTTP Headers
subformOptions.description: Headers to inject in the requests.

subformOptions.label: Proxy URL
subformOptions.description: HTTP proxy server to use to connect to the targets.

subformOptions.label: No Proxy
subformOptions.description: Comma-separated list of domains for which the proxy should not be used.

subformOptions.label: Proxy From Environment
subformOptions.description: Makes use of net/http ProxyFromEnvironment function to determine proxies.

subformOptions.label: Proxy Header Environment
subformOptions.description: Headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests.

subformOptions.description: Configures the TLS settings.
